Class Populator

java.lang.Object
Populator
public class Populator
extends java.lang.Object
Class which needs to be modified in order to complete some of the later milestones

    java.lang.String insertCSVData​(java.lang.String csvFileName, java.lang.String primaryTableToInsertInto)
    Method to take a csv file where the first row is a head of field names and all other rows are data to be inserted into the named table e.g.\\ DATA FILE LANGUAGE.CSV to be inserted into K: u 'English' 'French' 'Plutonian' results in: BEGIN TRANSACTION; -- NB might already exist -- INSERT OR IGNORE INTO K(u) VALUES( 'English' ); INSERT OR IGNORE INTO K(u) VALUES( 'French' ); INSERT OR IGNORE INTO K(u) VALUES( 'Plutonian' ); COMMIT;
    boolean insertCSVData​(java.lang.String csvFile, java.lang.String[] entities, java.lang.String[] relations)
    Inserts data from a csv file into the set of entities (and related relationships) A super stretch question You will have to work out which entities contain which attributes and then work out the order in which they should be inserted where relations are involved, you may have needed to add extra attributes to tables to code 1:M relationships which will have their own names not in the er diagram! This class will therefore have to 'know' about the extra attibutes
    void instoCSV​(java.lang.String csvFileName, java.lang.String primaryTableToInsertInto, java.lang.String secondaryTableToInsertInto, java.lang.String fileNameToSaveTo, boolean append)
    DO NOT MODIFY Insert data from a single csv file which spans two entities This is not easy and is a stretch problem

    • milestone1

      public java.lang.String milestone1​(java.lang.String csvFileName, java.lang.String tableToInsertInto)
      A single text file containing all the INSERT..INTO statements required for the csv file: e.g. INSERT INTO R(p,l,k) VALUES( 101, 'Eric Noel', '2001-012-25' ); NB the text field values are quoted in primesâ€™.
      Parameters:
      csvFileName - name of the csv file containing the data
      tableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert data into
      Returns:
      a string composed of the DML statements needed to insert the data.

      Parameters:

      tableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert data into
      fileNameToSaveTo - name of file to save the DML statements to
      append - determine if the contents should be appended to the file if it already exists

    • insertCSVData

      public java.lang.String insertCSVData​(java.lang.String csvFileName, java.lang.String primaryTableToInsertInto)
      Method to take a csv file where the first row is a head of field names and all other rows are data to be inserted into the named table e.g.\\ DATA FILE LANGUAGE.CSV to be inserted into K: u 'English' 'French' 'Plutonian' results in: BEGIN TRANSACTION; -- NB might already exist -- INSERT OR IGNORE INTO K(u) VALUES( 'English' ); INSERT OR IGNORE INTO K(u) VALUES( 'French' ); INSERT OR IGNORE INTO K(u) VALUES( 'Plutonian' ); COMMIT;
      Parameters:
      csvFileName - name of the csvFile containing the data NB fileName does not have to match the entity name
      primaryTableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert into
      Returns:
      a sql string containing appropriate insert into statements

    • milestone5

      public java.lang.String milestone5​(java.lang.String csvFileName, java.lang.String primaryTableToInsertInto, java.lang.String secondaryTableToInsertInto)
      A single text file containing all the correct INSERT..INTO statements for data which involves TWO entities. e.g.\\ DATA FILE HERO.CSV to be inserted into R and G: p,l,k,h,f 101,'Eric Noel','2001-12-25','Eric Noel', 'Santa Clause' results in: PRAGMA foreign_keys=ON; BEGIN TRANSACTION; -- NB might already exist -- INSERT OR IGNORE INTO R(p,l,k) VALUES( 101, 'Eric Noel', '2001-012-25' ); INSERT INTO G(p,h,f) VALUES (101,'Eric Noel','Santa Clause'); COMMIT;
      Parameters:
      csvFileName - name of the csv file containing the data
      primaryTableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert data into
      secondaryTableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert data into which has a foreign key dependency on the primaryTableToInsertInto i.e. data can't be put into secondaryTableToInsertInto if there is no related item in the primaryTableToInsertInto
      Returns:
      a string composed of the DML statements needed to insert the data.

    • instoCSV

      public void instoCSV​(java.lang.String csvFileName, java.lang.String primaryTableToInsertInto, java.lang.String secondaryTableToInsertInto, java.lang.String fileNameToSaveTo, boolean append)
      DO NOT MODIFY Insert data from a single csv file which spans two entities This is not easy and is a stretch problem
      Parameters:
      csvFileName - name of the csv file containing the data
      primaryTableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert data into
      secondaryTableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert data into which has a foreign key dependency on the primaryTableToInsertInto i.e. data can't be put into secondaryTableToInsertInto if there is no related item in the primaryTableToInsertInto
      fileNameToSaveTo - name of file to save the DML statements to
      append - determine if the contents should be append to a file if it already exists

    • updateAllAges

      public void updateAllAges()
      A method to update the ages in R.c based on R.k which is a date of birth. See the courswork assignment for an appropriate sql update statement.

    • updateCensus

      public void updateCensus()
      A method to update the Plaent census data in F.i based on I and R which is the relationship(I) of who (R) lives on which planet(F). NB, the census data is the count of people where their age (R.c) is LESS than 100 years on the date of the census. ALSO ignore ages which are less than 0.

    • insertCSVData

      public boolean insertCSVData​(java.lang.String csvFile, java.lang.String[] entities, java.lang.String[] relations)
      Inserts data from a csv file into the set of entities (and related relationships) A super stretch question You will have to work out which entities contain which attributes and then work out the order in which they should be inserted where relations are involved, you may have needed to add extra attributes to tables to code 1:M relationships which will have their own names not in the er diagram! This class will therefore have to 'know' about the extra attibutes
      Parameters:
      csvFile - the path of the csv file. The file will ALWAYS have a header row at the start which indicates the attribute names.
      entities - the array of entities which may be needed
      relations - the array of relationships which may be needed
      Returns:
      return true if the process was successfull

    • listSuperHeroesContainingPower

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> listSuperHeroesContainingPower​(java.lang.String txt)
      Method to find all of the super heroes in the database which have a power containing the the value of txt
      Parameters:
      txt - the text which is contained in a super heroes power
      Returns:
      a list of the hidden identies of the super heroes with a power

    • entityAttributes

      public java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> entityAttributes​(java.lang.String entityName)

    • createInsertSQLForCsvFile

      public java.lang.String createInsertSQLForCsvFile​(java.lang.String csvFile, java.lang.String[] entities, java.lang.String[] relations)
      Method to create appropriate sql statements to insert data from a csv file
      Parameters:
      csvFile - path to the csv file. The file will ALWAYS have a header row at the start which indicates the attribute names.
      entities - the array of entities which may be needed
      relations - the array of relationships which may be needed
      Returns:
      DML sql string which will insert data into the entities from the csv file

      public void milestone6​(java.lang.String csvFileName, java.lang.String primaryTableToInsertInto, java.lang.String secondaryTableToInsertInto) throws java.lang.Exception

      Parameters:
      csvFileName - name of the csv file containing the data
      primaryTableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert data into
      secondaryTableToInsertInto - name of the table to insert data into which has a foreign key dependency on the primaryTableToInsertInto i.e. data can't be put into secondaryTableToInsertInto if there is no related item in the primaryTableToInsertInto
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - it could all go horribly wrong

    • changeHomePlanet

      public void changeHomePlanet​(int i, java.lang.String planetName) throws Populator.UnknownPlanetException, Populator.UnknownPersonException
      method to change the home world of a person R NB if the planet does not exist
      Parameters:
      i - is the p of the person entity (R)
      planetName - is the name of the planet that the person moves to (attribute t in entity F)
      Throws:
      Populator.UnknownPlanetException - if planet does not exists
      Populator.UnknownPersonException - if the person does not exist

      Returns:

      Throws:
